title: These states have multiple critical races that will determine control of the Senate, House and state governments. Here's what you need to know
These 6 states could determine much about America's future on election night
Here are the closing arguments for 2022 -- and what they mean
description: The heavy hitters of American politics are hitting the campaign trail to deliver some closing arguments about the importance of next Tuesday's election.

title: The 10 Senate seats most likely to flip in 2022
Biden gave election warning, Tucker Carlson blasted him for it
description: President Biden spoke about candidates denying election results in a speech right-wing media deemed hyper-political. CNN's senior media reporter Oliver Darcy discusses the rhetoric emanating from Tucker Carlson and others as these commentators encourage audiences to question election results that haven't been announced yet.

title: French MP brings parliament to a halt by yelling 'Go back to Africa' to Black MP
description: France's lower house of parliament suspended its session on Thursday after a far-right MP shouted, "Go back to Africa!" as a Black legislator from the far left asked a question about immigration.

title: Nuclear inspectors find no evidence of Putin's 'dirty bomb' claims
Tonga eruption sent the highest-recorded volcanic plume into Earth's atmosphere
description: When the Hunga Tonga-Hunga Ha'apai volcano erupted underwater in January, it created a plume of ash and water that broke through the third layer of Earth's atmosphere.

title: Warring parties have agreed to a truce in Ethiopia's two-year civil war. Here's what to know
description: When Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed received the Nobel Peace Prize in 2019, he was lauded as a regional peacemaker. A year later, he launched a conflict that spiraled into a brutal civil war, spawning one of the worst humanitarian crises in the world.

title: Israeli PM Yair Lapid congratulates Netanyahu on election victory
description: Israeli Prime Minister Yair Lapid called Benjamin Netanyahu to congratulate him on winning Israel's elections, the prime minister's office announced Thursday, just under 48 hours after polls closed.

title: Justice Department rests in its historic seditious conspiracy case against Oath Keepers
description: Federal prosecutors rested their case on Thursday against five alleged leaders of the far-right  Oath Keepers militia group, ending the initial phase of the first seditious conspiracy trial in over a decade.

title: Shelley Duvall returns to acting after 20 years
description: Shelley Duvall is returning to the big screen, 20 years after her last film role.

title: Why 75% of likely voters think the US is in a recession — even though it's probably not
description: A new CNN poll shows that three-quarters of likely voters feel like the US economy is in a recession. It's probably not, but that's not the point.

title: Rest is indeed resistance. For me and others, so is being child-free
description: A bold manifesto is urging us to learn how to rest as an act of political and cultural self-preservation. "Rest is Resistance: A Manifesto," by Tricia Hersey (founder of The Nap Ministry), makes the important argument that "grind culture," a.k.a. our addiction to 24/7 busyness, is a product of White supremacy and dead-end capitalism.

title: How to love a country with a complicated history
description: Decades before George Takei became Mr. Sulu on the original "Star Trek" series, he was imprisoned for a crime he never committed.

title: Selena Gomez's new documentary impacted her body image
description: Selena Gomez says her new documentary, "Selena Gomez: My Mind & Me," has shifted her view on her body image.

title: How Asian Americans fit into the affirmative action debate
description: Affirmative action is on trial again, and this time Asian Americans are at the center.

title: Rico Lewis earns rave reviews as 17-year-old breaks Karim Benzema's Champions League record
description: It was a night to remember for Rico Lewis as the 17-year-old scored on his full debut to inspire Manchester City's comeback 3-1 victory over Sevilla.

title: National Sandwich Day has chains serving up sandwich deals today
description: Who can resist a sandwich — especially if it's free?

title: Ina Garten's husband sends spicy texts that sometimes 'go astray'
description: It sounds like things are still hot in the kitchen with Ina Garten and her husband of more than 50 years.

title: Why high temperatures can make planes too heavy to take off
description: Our planet's rising temperatures are making it harder for planes to take off at certain airports, presenting yet another challenge to civil aviation. And as heatwaves become more frequent, the problem could extend to more flights, forcing airlines to leave passengers on the ground.

title: TikTok makes clear European data can be accessed by China-based employees
description: TikTok updated its privacy policies for European users on Tuesday, adding explicit disclosures that personal data from the app may be viewed by employees in China.

title: As many as 14,000 arrested in Iran over last six weeks, United Nations says
description: As many as 14,000 people have been arrested in Iran during protests there since September, according to a top United Nations official.

title: Super Bowl champion Sam Shields regrets playing in NFL; says his head is 'all mushed together' with concussions
description: Former Green Bay Packers cornerback Sam Shields has said he regrets playing in the NFL, pointing to the effects concussions and head injuries had on his career and his later life.

title: Takeoff's murder: Details from the coroner's report and Offset's subtle tribute
description: New details regarding the death of Takeoff have been revealed as the artist continues to be mourned.

title: Clinton accuses Republicans of trying to 'scare voters' over crime
description: Former Secretary of State Hillary Clinton on Thursday said the Republican focus on crime ahead of the 2022 midterm elections was clear hypocrisy, telling CNN's Don Lemon that the party is not "concerned about voter safety, they just want to keep voters scared."

title: 'Ironic and frankly disturbing': Hillary Clinton on GOP response to Pelosi attack
description: Hillary Clinton talks with CNN's Don Lemon about campaign messaging ahead of the midterms and says that Republicans are trying to "scare voters" over crime.

title: Netflix launches 'Basic with Ads' — its much anticipated commercial-supported plan
description: In 2019, Netflix said in a letter to shareholders "we... are advertising free," and added that being commercial-free is a "deep part of our brand proposition."

title: The latest in luxurious first-class airplane suites: Building up
description: With airlines seeking to use the floor space footprint of their first-class suites as efficiently as possible, the latest developments in making these ultraswanky experiences even more luxurious aren't about adding more width or length to the suites.

title: Seven grain ships leave Ukrainian ports after revival of deal
'Enola Holmes 2' cleverly puts Millie Bobby Brown back on the case
description: The game is afoot (again) in "Enola Holmes 2," a wonderful showcase for Millie Bobby Brown that this time manages to work the character's famous brother, Sherlock, more organically into the mix. Throw in fact-based underpinnings about horrid working conditions during the time and you have the makings for a very polished sequel -- one that makes the whole thing look elementary, and a whole lot of fun.

title: Watch election official answer skeptics' voting questions
description: Misinformation about voting has grown rampant in the last two years and confidence in elections has fallen. CNN asked an election official in the key swing state of Arizona to respond directly to questions from voters at recent events for Arizona Republican Gubernatorial nominee Kari Lake.

title: CNN spotlights 10 men and women who are making the world a better place
description: The smallest acts of kindness can have the biggest impact on the world, and these 10 men and women are shining examples of that.

title: Former Prime Minister Imran Khan shot in foot in assassination attempt at rally in Pakistan
description: Gunshots were fired Thursday at a rally held by Pakistan's ex-Prime Minister Imran Khan in Gujranwallah, Pakistan, according to a spokesperson for Khan's PTI party.

title: Homes in White neighborhoods are being appraised at higher values than in communities of color, new report finds
description: Homes in predominately White neighborhoods are being assessed at twice the value of homes in communities of color with comparable amenities, according to a new report released Wednesday.

title: Video shows rally where Imran Khan was shot
description: A livestream captured footage from a rally outside the town of Gujranwallah, Pakistan, where former Prime Minister Imran Khan was shot. CNN's Sophia Saifi reports.

title: How a little known Czech pastry became a big Texas hit
description: They don't sound like your typical Texan delicacy, but thanks to Czech immigrants, kolaches hold a special place in the heart of hungry Texans.

title: Rafael Nadal isn't confident about World Tour Finals after suffering Paris Masters defeat
description: Rafael Nadal is out of the Paris Masters after being defeated by Tommy Paul -- and the Spaniard isn't betting on winning the ATP Tour Finals, either.

title: Gupta explains 'psychedelic renaissance' happening in America
description: A single dose of a synthetic version of the mind-altering component of magic mushrooms, psilocybin, improved depression in people with a treatment-resistant form of the disease, a new study found. CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta reports.

title: Bank of England fights inflation with biggest rate hike in 33 years
description: The Bank of England raised interest rates by three quarters of a percentage point on Thursday, the biggest hike in 33 years, as it tries to contain soaring inflation even as the UK economy slides towards recession.

title: Immigration officials say Pelosi attacker was in US illegally
description: David DePape, the man accused of violently attacking Paul Pelosi last week, was in the United States illegally and may face deportation, the Department of Homeland Security said late Wednesday.

title: The culture wars have come to the classroom. Now what?
description: There are many problems roiling America's public schools, including culture wars that have found their way into the classroom, school libraries and school board meetings over the past several months. But some challenges are more endemic, the product of decades of low pay and lack of appreciation for the service that administrators and teachers perform. CNN Opinion gathered the views of nine experts in the field of education about the problems they feel should be most urgently addressed in the classroom -- and what solutions might be viable in our tumultuous political times.

title: Clinton to hit the trail in her deep blue home as New York governor race tightens
description: When Hillary Clinton takes the stage on Thursday in New York City to boost Democrats in her deep blue adopted home, it will be an unfamiliar scene for someone who was the party's presidential standard bearer just six years ago.

title: Luka Doncic becomes only third player in NBA history to record seven 30-plus points to begin season
description: Luka Doncic continued his scorching start to the 2022-23 NBA season and matched a record which only two NBA Hall of Famers have recorded.

title: South Korea star Son Heung-Min suffers fractured eye and faces race to be fit for World Cup
description: Son Heung-Min's hopes of playing at the World Cup later this month are in doubt after Tottenham confirmed the South Korean star will need surgery on a fracture around his left eye.

title: Kyrie Irving, Brooklyn Nets each to donate $500,000 to anti-hate organizations; NBA star takes 'responsibility' for negative impact of tweets
description: Kyrie Irving and the Brooklyn Nets announced on Wednesday that they will both donate $500,000 towards anti-hate organizations after the point guard tweeted a documentary deemed to be antisemitic last week.

title: The 10 Senate seats most likely to flip in 2022
description: The race for the House is tilting strongly toward the GOP, but the struggle for Senate control is still very much a slog that could go either way, even as late-breaking national winds favor the party out of power.

title: 'Only God knows when we can meet,' says marathon runner Gotytom Gebreslase, cut off from her parents amid conflict in Ethiopia
description: It's almost a year since marathon runner Gotytom Gebreslase last spoke to her parents over the phone, a detachment she feels most strongly during races.

title: What to look for in the last jobs report before the midterms
description: When the Bureau of Labor Statistics releases its October jobs report on Friday, it will be the last major read of the economy before the midterm elections — and it will cap a week of new data signaling that the white-hot labor market is showing only tentative signs of cooling off.

title: Fall back: See how 2,000 clocks were wound back across the British parliament
description: From the Great Clock of Westminster to antique timepieces - when British Summertime ended and the clocks fell back one hour, a small team of clockmakers adjusted 2,000 clocks across the Palace of Westminster to keep British lawmakers working on time.

title: Death of boy in lockdown fuels backlash against China's zero-Covid policy
description: The death of a 3-year-old boy following a suspected gas leak at a locked down residential compound in northwestern China has triggered a fresh wave of outrage at the country's stringent zero-Covid policy.

title: Ukrainian investigators look for evidence of war crimes
description: CNN's Clarissa Ward joins a team of Ukrainian investigators looking for evidence of war crimes -- specifically rape and other acts of sexual violence -- at the hands of Russian soldiers.

title: The latest on Russia's war in Ukraine
Ukraine claims it hit significant Russian military systems in Kherson
Saltwater has infiltrated a Louisiana parish's drinking supply as drought slows the Mississippi River. It could put residents with health issues at risk
description: About 3,000 residents in a Louisiana community south of New Orleans have been warned saltwater permeated their drinking water supply, posing a threat to residents with health risks.

title: Climate activists sentenced to prison for Vermeer protest
description: A Dutch court sent two Belgian climate change activists to prison Wednesday for a protest targeting Johannes Vermeer's painting "Girl with a Pearl Earring."

title: See inside a Kyiv hospital amid intense Russian missile attacks on the city
description: CNN's Salma Abdelaziz reports from a Kyiv hospital that was left struggling without running water after Russian missiles plunged Ukraine's capital into darkness.

title: Friends remember American student killed in Seoul Halloween disaster
description: • Halloween crush investigators raid police stations across Seoul

title: Call to Earth Day 2022: A global mission to protect our oceans
No-hitter thrown for just the second time in World Series history as Astros beat Phillies in Game 4
description: For just the second time in World Series history, a no-hitter has been thrown as four Houston Astros pitchers completed the feat against the Philadelphia Phillies Wednesday night to win 5-0 and secure their place in baseball lore.

title: In newly liberated villages, Ukrainian investigators are documenting allegations of sexual assault by Russian troops
description:
• Russian military discussed nuclear weapons: US intel
• Live: The latest on Russia's war in Ukraine

title: Paramotorist takes action after spotting a woman clinging to submerged car in canal
description: While paramotoring -- a form of flying with a small engine and a paraglider -- a Miami man spotted a woman clinging to her car submerged in a canal.

title: 'She just flat-out lied': Cooper calls out Kari Lake's false claim about Paul Pelosi
description: CNN's Anderson Cooper and Daniel Dale discuss Arizona Republican gubernatorial nominee Kari Lake's recent comments denying that she made light of the attack of Paul Pelosi. Lake is blaming "creative editing" from the "fake news media," which is false.

title: 87-year-old 'Queen of the Deep' has spent more than 7,000 hours underwater
Tapper explains shadowy Russian mercenary group
description: CNN's Jake Tapper sheds light on the Wagner Group, a private Russian mercenary group that has largely operated in the shadows.

title: The Australian teenager on a mission to protect ragged-tooth sharks
description: With a menacing grin, needle-like teeth, and a sharp pointed snout, a gray nurse shark isn't a creature that most people would want to encounter. But Shalise Leesfield isn't most people.

title: Florida school mass shooter sentenced to life in prison
description:
Nikolas Cruz, who murdered 17 students and staff with a semi-automatic rifle at a Florida high school, was formally sentenced to life in prison on Wednesday after listening to hours of anguished...

title: North Korean missile launch triggers evacuation warnings in Japan
description: • First on CNN: US accuses North Korea of hiding ammo shipments to Russia

title: Future Buys $16.3 Million Miami Mansion
description:
The future is bright for Future when it comes to his real estate portfolio ... because he just dropped 10 figures on an island paradise. Real estate sources tell TMZ ... the "Mask Off" rapper...

title: North Korean missile launch triggers evacuation warnings in Japan
description:
North Korea fired at least one unidentified ballistic missile on Thursday local time, according to South Korea's Joint Chiefs of Staff , who said it landed in waters off the east of the peninsula.

#northkorean #jointchiefsofstaff #east #peninsula #missilelaunch

title: US President calls on American voters to defend democracy from election deniers and stand against political violence
description: President Joe Biden on Wednesday delivered a warning that American democracy is under assault from election deniers who are running for office at all levels as he tries to make defending democracy a top issue in next week's midterm elections.
